metadata.Title: CVE-2023-21264 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - high.
metadata.Description:
In multiple functions of mem_protect.c, there is a possible way to access hypervisor memory due to a memory access check in the wrong place. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation. It was discovered that the ARM64 KVM implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly restrict hypervisor memory access. An attacker in a guest VM could use this to execute arbitrary code in the host OS.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-21264` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-33-generic - 6.2.0-33.33
linux-image-6.2.0-33-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-33.33
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-33-generic - 6.2.0-33.33
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-33-generic-64k - 6.2.0-33.33
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1012-aws - 6.2.0-1012.12
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-33.33').
linux-allwinner: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
